website_summaries.verdict: By far the most popular Cobra pliers offered by the brand, this 10-inch product is sure to impress.
pros: Customers appreciate their comfort in hand
Highly durable with a secure grip
cons: Many buyers had problems with the product arriving with missing parts

website_summaries.verdict: Comfortable pliers to use with an excellent grip. Easy to adjust the jaw while you're working.
pros: Includes a guard to prevent pinching of fingers
High-quality tool from a trusted brand name
Tool's jaw grip pressure ranks highly
Handles coated with plastic to prevent your hands from slipping
Easy to adjust width of jaws
cons: Small jaws won't work for large items
You'll pay a little extra for this quality

website_summaries.verdict: Strong and well made, but if you want top quality and versatility, there are better models.
pros: A 10-inch model that's both lightweight and rugged
Streamlined design easily fits awkward spaces
Easy to adjust and comfortable to use
cons: Not as effective on smaller items, because the grip tends to slip off smaller objects

customer_reviews.title: Use them all the time, very satisfied, "big pipe" electrician on cell tower sites
customer_reviews.text: Use them all the time, more comfortable than their American counterparts. Great grip, use the for big rigid conduits, up to 4". Put all my weight onto them, while it may only be 170 pounds, I have really pounded on these pliers with no slippage. I use them to tighten couplings in the threading machine without incident, I say this because a Klein pair met their demise this way. They are heavier than your standard 480 big azz channel locks. I like them a lot. I use them a lot. They get borrowed a lot. Lots of compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkyanonymous

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time buying or looking at any other brand. These will not disappoint and will be around for as long as you are. I have probably a dozen different types of channel lock type pliers in my toolbox that are now not touched. Jaws will grab like a pipe wrench or a crescent wrench with exceptional grip. Best pliers I have ever owned in over 30 years of various mechanical work including aerospace, construction, and heavy machinery.
customer_reviews.author: I. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: Love 'em. I'm on my second pair. The first pair I had were made by Knipex and re-branded as Craftsman and sold by Sears. They were the same thing except they had an additional vinyl grip over top of the kinda of orange peel texture of the Knipex. They were so nice they walked off on the job, so I got this pair. I have no complaints, they work great and are more adjustable than the standard tongue and groove style Channelocks. The teeth and shape of the jaws are also better than standard Channelocks. They get a much better purchase on things and the pliers are more easily adjusted with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Best Value In The Cobra Line
customer_reviews.text: Buy these just to show your friends they're unbelievable, 22 in (560mm). They are huge, so much larger and heavy weight versus the 16 in (400mm) version it difficult to describe. These are as robust a a pipe wrench, a serious weapon. For the price by far the cheapest set of Cobra pliers by the pound, by a long shot, real value for money.
customer_reviews.author: jaldeborgh

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect "pocket plier".
customer_reviews.text: I own various channel locks, Klein, and vise grip pliers. They are great for specific jobs, like opening a sewer clean out. What I needed was a versatile and top quality plier I could carry in my pocket and get almost every household task done. The adjustment button is genius and the steel is very high quality. When I grip something it does not have a chance of slipping from the jaws.
customer_reviews.author: BenK

customer_reviews.title: the grip kinda sucks for what im paying for
customer_reviews.text: i have used the same set of 2 irwens for 3 years with no problems but wanted an upgrade. so i got a couple of these these grip just as well in my opinion. but are much lighter. the grip kinda sucks for what im paying for. the locking action is also poor in my opinion. its very hard to adjust with one hand compared to the irwens. i use both of these as pipe wrench replacements for 50% of the work i do and overall the knipex is a well built tool that fits nice in the tool bag. but i wont be buying again. the price is not worth the product
customer_reviews.author: A Useful Yung Guy

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Sized Wonder
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the 87-100 4" Cobra pliers. I am a Knipex fan and have 30+ pairs of their pliers, cutters, and pliers wrenches in my tool box. As usual Knipex did not disappoint me as the finish quality is perfect. Pros: These pliers are super compact and fit into a custom knife sheath on my belt. They are extremely lightweight and I almost forget they are with me. The one hand adjustment is new, but after a few uses It becomes routine. The knurled handles (non-rubberized grips) are awesome and easy to use. Cons: The oil coating was thick and difficult to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Better Gripping & Adjustment than Channellocks
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these on a recommendation from YouTuber "AvE". Great design!!!! Their design has a better grip than Channellocks, especially towards the jaw tips, which allows more force for turning the fastener and less force "squeezing" the jaws closed when in tight places. Their precise slip joint adjustment allows for a more "squared up" jaw parallel contact with the fastener's "flats". At times, the Channellock's slip joint adjustment doesn't allow for the upper and lower jaws to be parallel when grasping the "flats" of a fastener, causing slipping. A welcomed addition to my tool box!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great general use pliers
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't even consider myself a weekend warrior, but sometimes you just want a good pair of pliers. These are very good general use pliers and the 10" seems like a great size for a one-size-fits-most. I absolutely love the craftsmanship. It's smooth, feels like, won't pinch, teeth have great grip, and even the tip of the mouth is so well designed that it can grasp even seemingly flush surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I had a real stubborn nut/bolt on a chair I was repairing. The threading was ripped from the broken chair piece, so all I had to grip was threading. I needed good wrench to grip the threading while I unscrewed the bolt from this threaded nut. This did it flawlessly; you can see the metal shavings. I was positive my allan wrench on the other end was going to break, but this wrench was rock solid. Felt the "snap" and the threading loosened from the bolt. Very happy with the result and happy to add this to my tool bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!!
customer_reviews.text: I had been struggling for days to get a stuck aerator off of my faucet!! I tried all kinds of suggestions and several different pliers plus rust busters (WD-40 and another) and Lime Away and even peroxide!! The darn thing would not come off!! The pliers I used just seem to slip around and not grab. I got this pair of pliers (KNIPEX Tools 87 01 250 10-Inch Cobra Pliers) this morning and tried them out and off came the aerator!! I was so happy!! Needless to say, I wish I had known about these sooner!! Now I can hook up my new portable washer to my kitchen sink!
customer_reviews.author: BeBe

customer_reviews.title: I think these belong in any EDC kit
customer_reviews.text: These blow the tiny Channel Lock pliers out of the water. Everything about these is high quality and extremely versatile. I really think one shouldn't leave the house without these. These fit great in the pocket and though I wouldn't use these on bolts and nuts that I don't want to impart some damage, I've used them in so many situations that it's almost ridiculous. I still carry a multi-tool, but these are amazing pliers that really compliment a multitool. I work in large industry and it can be handy there and I use it all the time doing home/vehicle maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: William J Renfrow

customer_reviews.title: Cobra 125/6 inch maybe little smaller than you think.
customer_reviews.text: Knipex really is the best pliers around and I have several different kinds but the 125 also known as the 5 inch ones are just a little too small for me. If I could go back id stick with the 6 inch ones. They are a little longer but they feel like a real set of pliers the 5 inch ones just feel a little to flimsy to me. I'm sure that they are tough and maybe its just in my head but if your not worried about an extra half inch or so of length and a little more weight id go with the 150 also know as the 6 inch model.
customer_reviews.author: Jake lacy

customer_reviews.title: Toolbox won't be complete without you
customer_reviews.text: Tools, are one of those things where it's better to have it and not need it, than need it and not have it. Well. I needed one, and I didn't have it when I was working on some seized power steering lines in a super cramped engine bay of my friend's Porsche. Regular wrenches and flare wrenches were too long, and the lock nut was already slightly rounded - no way was I getting that loose with normal means. Buddy handed me these tiny cobras and I laughed at him. Well, let's say he had the last laugh, and I now have one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Waylan Wong

customer_reviews.title: Love the German precision
customer_reviews.text: Have numerous sets of Channelock pliers. The Knipex pliers take it one step further. They are ultra precise, highly adjustable and solid locking pliers. Perfect for automotive and tractor repair and maintenance. These are really good for unscrewing Philip head screws the have a stripped head. I just removed a Philips head screw that was holds the coil on the Aluminum cylinder head of my 1981 Yamaha golf cart. These pliers were able to grab the screw head unlike any other pair of pliers or Vise Grips.
customer_reviews.author: Prof100Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best Pliers Money Can Buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought Knipex 8701180 7-1/4-Inch Cobra Pliers for my work. I needed a good pliers to be able to remove 3/4 inch fitting from the end of the faucet in order to clean a nozzle (I have to do it about ones per couple weeks). I work in the Lab and run a sieve test daily. This pliers are perfect for it. They are very nice and quality. I ordered them from HomewareStore-Germany because of the best price. They shipped them immediately and I received them in 12 days. I recommend them to anyone who needs the best quality pliers money can buy. Thank you HomewareStore-Germany.
customer_reviews.author: bill35

customer_reviews.title: THEY SENT WRONG SIZE(SENT ME 5" AND ORDERED 6"!!! DID NOT CATCH IT UNTIL MONTHS LATER#
customer_reviews.text: I Loved the design and how useful they are BUT REALIZED about two weeks ago they sent me the 5" not the 6 " as in description. They make a 6 and they are bigger which is what I needed and ordered. I ended up going and buying the 6" elsewhere. How I realized they sent me the wrong pair was a showed a friend at work and he got some well his were Bigger......Same design, same description on order. But I have wore the 5" out alot before I caught it. Other than that Knipex is TOP Notch I also bought the adjustment pliers that work as a adjustable wrench only a lot faster to work with
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Not really impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say I’m really impressed for the price and for the money I like my IRWIN better. They have real sloppy jaws and the close up is off to one side. The side to side play in the jaws may be an assest but at 65 years old it was always an indication of cheaply made pliers too me. The grip is uncomfortable and I will have to tape it. Bottom line is that this is my first set of knipex pliers and the last.
customer_reviews.author: FR

customer_reviews.title: You will be more attractive if you have these pliers.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, misleading headline. Sorry. These pliers are tiny, useful, perfect. I carry them in my pocket all day every day, like a pocket knife. Probably not the best way to impress the ladies, I know, but for those of you who are fortunate enough to be happily married... well, you need these. Actually, everybody needs these. Seriously, don't worry about the price if you need small utility pliers regularly, then just get these. Twenty years from now you will still be glad you did. Knipex is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Every man needs these pliers
customer_reviews.text: I helped my son replace his water heater. His pipe wrench, with a pipe on the handle failed to take the coupling off the top of the heater. I said, wait a minute, I have something. I put the pipe on the handle of my Cobras and took them off. His eyes kind of bugged out. So I said, here son, take mine, every man needs a pair of these. I cost me, as I have two other sons. These are heritage quality tools.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The best channies out there!
customer_reviews.text: The very best!!! These channies will lock in place, and stay in place, with the push of a button, until you implement another width. Super fast efficiency combined with MUCH lighter weight, compared to traditional channies. . . yet very durable, tough, and German made. I use them for compression fittings on EMT, rigid conduit, and any other common task you will find on a industrial/commercial job site that involves electrical installation. On 3 inch conduit, or higher; I convert back to the original channel lock brand, with the big azz series.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Guengerich

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: good quality...but this is not anywhere near as useful as the 7 inch variety. i also like the "alligator" version better (no push button). again, a good quality tool, just not my preference. update 1/28/15: had to give the full 5 stars because knipex makes some quality tools, including this set of pliers. i still maintain my preference for the 7 inch version, and i also prefer the alligator style of slip joint to this push button style. but those are personal preferences. this tool is what it says it is, and it is durable and high quality. if you need a small set of pliers, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: greatwhite22

customer_reviews.title: An upgrade over the classic Channellocks
customer_reviews.text: These are just flat out better than the comparable channellock version. There is more adjustment range with these, much finer increments and much smoother operation vs the slop that is inherent with the channel/groove design of the channellocks. The tooth/jaw design+geometry exert an enormous amount of force. I am definitely going to get the smaller size of these legendary Cobra's however I think I'll stick w/my Channellocks for the huge 16.5-inch size - I rarely use that size and the cost/benefit doesn't make sense.
customer_reviews.author: DRK

customer_reviews.title: It's a Ferrari of wrenches
customer_reviews.text: I decided to spoil myself with one of these. Wow are they nice, so much better than a channel-lock or whatever the non defacto name is for them. Hold great, thin profile, so easy to get in places, tight tolerances, e.g. the jaws meet exactly instead of being off by 1/16". Red coating is already turning colors from my greasy hands, but that is to be expected as it's a tool after all...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: shocked
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for about 2 weeks now. At first i didn't try them on certain things because all pliers i have used in the past would not have worked, so i didn't think of trying these. Eventually i started using them more and more and now they are my go to for anything that needs to be squeezed, pulled or twisted. The shape of the head make them a good choice when trying to grab something and use leverage. It is almost like a squeezable pry bar. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Spitfish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: The 7-1/4 inch Cobra Pliers and the 7 inch pliers wrench have been my most used tools as an Instrument Tech. I received them 3 months ago, and they still work like the day I received them. Only problem I've had is the button to adjust the opening size on the Cobra Pliers fell off. Tool still works. It just takes more pressure to activate the slide. Sent them an email about warranty right before I wrote this review.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: May break sooner than you'd hope
customer_reviews.text: These broke within a few months of normal use. I'll be calling Knipex to see if they will warranty since I've only had them six months and they broke within 2. The "return window" was a whole month. Good grief.
customer_reviews.author: Sara21

customer_reviews.title: Best mini pliers on the market! 100% recommend the 125mm pair.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to carry in a pocket everywhere I go just in-case I need some small, strong, and highly adjustable pliers. They fit ANYWHERE, and they open up the largest in their size category (1-1.5" depending on how you're using them), whereas other brands only open up to around 1/2". They're incredibly strong for their size and their steel is hard, as I was able to completely smush a screw's tip with the plier tips and there was no damage on my pliers. Hot tip: These 125mm Knipex Cobras fit perfectly into a Buck 110 Leather Sheath!
customer_reviews.author: Vladimirror

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my EDC tool pouch
customer_reviews.text: Was wavering between the 5" and 6" pliers, glad I went with this. Compact enough for regular carry and handling small jobs; only benefit for the 5" I can think of is if you had clearance concerns. Craftsmanship is great, no issues with finish, doesn't feel "cheap" even I got this through Amazon Warehouse. It's my first Knipex tool, will definitely not be my last...gonna try and pick up all the sizes now, so much nicer than standard crescent wrenches or channel lock pliers. Will update review if I run into issues, but I doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: Can't get better pliers than those.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional, who uses pliers everyday. I did use them a few times and they are the best pliers I have ever owned and used. They are very easy to adjust and they will not slip once locked. My usual pliers are hard to adjust and I have used some nasty language at times when they did slip and bust my knuckles. These old pliers are already in the roundfile and have gone to pliers heaven. I would certainly think, that these pliers are of professional quality. I highly recommend them. I also just ordered the 12inch pliers, just in case I run into having to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt B

customer_reviews.title: Buy them you wont own another brand after
customer_reviews.text: The best hands down You will never buy another brand again. After using them a few times and you try another plier. You put them down and get these. They are truly the best. I am a tradesman and we all carry these
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Shanholtzer

customer_reviews.title: This is the very best tool I own!
customer_reviews.text: The jaws expand wide for plumbing; the padded handles don't slip off; the tips are narrow enough to use like needle nose pliers for electrical; the jaws are low profile -so they fit in narrow spaces like my drill chuck and close quarter fittings; great for rocking out nails & picking floor staples; I got a leather sheath and wear them every day and I give them both as gifts to all my contractors who also love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality tool that works much better than old school Channel Locks
customer_reviews.text: These are a surprisingly more effective version of the classic Channel Lock adjustables. However, these provide more surface area on a hex head, and therefore grip much better. Also, once you set them to the size you want (simply press the center and slide open or close), they stay in place and don't accidentally slip into a different position. The quality of materials and workmanship on these is also spectacular. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Clara B

customer_reviews.title: I really like not only the shape
customer_reviews.text: Knipex Need I say more? OK I will, I really like not only the shape, but also the slightly gritty dipped handle on these. I feel like they get the grip just right. Specifically the transition between having a solid grip on it in the palm of your hand, then holding them between your fingers to keep the mouth open. Its kind of hard to explain but I'm sure most tradesmen will understand.
customer_reviews.author: Gundam Wheat

customer_reviews.title: The grips smell terrible
customer_reviews.text: These pliers seem to work great after a day of limited use, however they smell awful out of the package. The grips are somewhat oily/greasy and the smell gets on your hands and sticks even after several washes. I’m sure this will go away in time but it’s a short term annoyance. The adjustment mechanism will take some getting use to after years of channellock pliers but the slim profile makes these a great plier.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Bionic finger helper always there when you need it.
customer_reviews.text: Bionic finger helper always there when you need it. Small enough to always have with you. I think of these my extra bionic fingers. Very useful and always with me. Jaws are precise and despite their small size manage to strongly grip and do what I can't on my own. Pricey but well worth it. Should outlast me. A quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: best pliers ever!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: if you have never used these they are the best pliers out there. I do not use anything but these. well worth the money, never use vice grips or pipe wrenches again. I know hard to fork out the money but I do it again. I bought these for a friend that snapped a head off bolt in intake manifold. had no problem removing stud left by head snapping off.
customer_reviews.author: Roundman72

customer_reviews.title: Neat tool!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a change from your dad's old Channellock tongue and groove pliers, in my opinion for the better. These are relatively light weight, yet sturdy. The textured grips are an improvement over the smooth plastic that I typically see on Knipex tools, hopefully they start using this material on all their different tools. The jaws and teeth are perfect. Hard and precisely aligned. There is noticeably more bite when using them on pipe or other round objects vs. conventional tongue and groove pliers. Another home run from a great tool company.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to Snap-On
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these pliers appear to be as good as Snap-On. Terrific grip, extremely durable, and quite comfortable to use. I tried using an impact etcher to write my initials on them but it did not even make a mark. That indicates that they wear very well. One caveat that I will add is that if your nut/bolt/screw will not turn, you will remove a significant amount of material trying to twist it out. That is just how good they are.
customer_reviews.author: Me the rater

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: I have owned these pliers for 8 years now and feel I have thoroughly tested them out. As a farmer I carry these every where I go, and use them constantly. The shape of the mouth in combination with the large range of adjustment make it perfect for almost any bolt. I used them for plumbing, electrical, auto repair, general construction and even camping. The curve on the head make these great for pulling nails too. I have also found them to be very durable, I owned my first pair for 7 years and have just purchase my second because i lost my first pair in a field. In short I will always own a pair of these pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knipex Quality
customer_reviews.text: Like all Knipex products this one is just as high of quality . The best channel locks (water pump pliers) that are on the market in my opinion. Very well machined and the teeth and machining on the jaws is hard and lasts a long time and doesn't wear out in the first use. The grip is nice and ergonomic and easy to clean. The adjustable button is easy to use and doesn't move on ya. I recommend these to anyone looking for some nice channel locks
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Dont wait, get these now.
customer_reviews.text: I am an electrical apprentice and I have had my eye on these for a while. I love the feel to them, very solid and not to clumsy either. These pliers do not pinch your hand if they let loose of a fastener either like other pliers. My favorite part of these pliers is how the lock in the position you are using them in. The dipped grip is also very comfortable and not too bulky. The jaws feel strong and grip tight. Cannot recommend these enough.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk_Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool while intact
customer_reviews.text: I work in injection molding. I use these pliers daily. When the tool is in one piece it works fine. However, the button to adjust the pliers has broken on two separate pairs, rendering them ineffective. If you’re buying these pliers to use occasionally, then I’d say they’re perfect for you. If you’re going to use them often, I’d suggest going with a company that has a free replacement policy.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Jon Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great tool - Just get these.
customer_reviews.text: These are great little pliers that I find more uses for all the time, heck, I just like holding them like a fidget tool. Well built and reliable. I want to integrate these in to my EDC load out but have yet to design a pouch to carry them with my other items. I find I'm using them mostly for leather stitching - yes, I should use a smooth face plier so I don't mar the needles but with the size of these pliers I find it very easy to control the pressure and control how I use them.
customer_reviews.author: OMG Leatherworks

customer_reviews.title: Best but Pricey
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely the best pliers I have ever owned. The micro adjustability is great, the coated handle is perfectly suited to the hand and the teeth are hardened. I was a bit hesitant to buy this because it is a bit pricey, but now that I’ve used for a while I guess I shouldn’t have waited. I see another 12” and a couple of smaller sizes in my future.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: These will get the job done. Ultimate grip strength!
customer_reviews.text: These boys exude quality craftsmanship. Able to grip on and handle nearly every job you throw at it. There's not a thing I've used these for that I wasn't able to torque loose. My buddy had a bolt all stripped out on his truck that he couldn't break loose. He'd been using many neighbors wrenches and ratchets and was unable to get it free. I got home from work and saw the crowd and brought these suckers out. Everyone was shocked at how easily these got the job done. I wish I had an affiliate link that day, because I bet I sold around 15 to 20 sets.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Extremely reliable pliers
customer_reviews.text: Knipex pliers do not disappoint. Have used the 22” pair at work several times (automotive field) and loved them so much I decided to buy this for myself. I currently own all of their cobra pliers and each one has its own thing its good at. The pliers are built extremely well and hold up to a lot of abuse! They’re pricey but extremely worth it compared to cheaper versions. The push button unlock is a wonderful part of these pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best adjustable pliers on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I use these pliers daily. Small enough to keep in your pocket. I've used them for pulling fuses, tightening battery cables, all the way up to lug nuts (yes, I said lug nuts.) I was able to loosen a stripped lug nut by standing on these small pliers. I never leave home without them.
customer_reviews.author: The_CONcept1

customer_reviews.title: these are great pliers. the way you have to set them ...
customer_reviews.text: these are great pliers. the way you have to set them to the size range you need instead of the usual slip style make all the difference. when you pick these up, they are set as opposed to the channel lock style which may change size if you don't grab them correctly. it isn't a big deal unless you are limited with one hand while the other is hold ing a part of keeping your balance up on or under something in a confined area. The gripping area of the jaws is well designed too.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured, but still great
customer_reviews.text: Call me crazy, but the picture specified the design as having dipped handles and a little bit different design. I received the new style plastic grippy crap. While not actually being crap, I am just a little disappointed. They are still super excellent in design and nothing is actually wrong with them but maybe they could update photos to reflect selling the new style. Note: Not as smooth as older style
customer_reviews.author: Saxon

customer_reviews.title: Know the product before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: We were disappointed in our purchase and returned the item. I was never informed these will not open wide like normal pliers or channel lock pliers. Aside from this, the product is built very well with top of the line materials. Just read more and watch YouTube videos before purchasing. Did not fit for our purpose but I am sure they have a purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Piel

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the small alligator pliers for years and thought they were the handiest most versatile pliers I have. But these with the button are a big upgrade. New king of the toolbag.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Bohn

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers hands down, and lots cheaper then buying fron the tool truck
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing mechanic work my whole life and I never liked using pliers ofmn nuts or bolts cause they always slipped and rounded the edges and we all know what a pain in the butt that is then about 10 years ago I found these pliers and they are outstanding bought my first pair off the snap on truck years ago for almost $90 so when I found these for less than $30 I had to buy me another pair
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Pettit

customer_reviews.title: No more channel locks for me.
customer_reviews.text: Knipex tools are great! Expensive - but that's often true of good tools. The trick is one jaw is split, and the other jaw hinges through the center of the split, so there is symmetric pressure on the hinge. No twisting force means really smooth clamping force, and that means these things really grip. Tighten a pipe with a pipe wrench, or worse with left side/right side hinged channel locks and you will either slip or at least mar the pipe. I own 4 of these of various sizes - I'm happy with them all.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Bone

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with knipex
customer_reviews.text: Tongue and groove pliers are a tool every tradesman should carry and there is no better choice than a pair of knipex pliers. Whether you go with the alligator or cobra you can't go wrong. I personally like to have a large and small set around. The head of these is so thin that you can get in places channellocks would give you a hard time with.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: EDC
customer_reviews.text: The Knipex 6" cobra is always on me. I feel naked without them. Sure I also have a Leatherman wave on me, but the pliers on the wave just aren't enough for larger tasks. I use these daily as a plumber, and around the house or wherever. I also own the 10", 12" cobras, and 10", 12" pliers wrench. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Fogle

customer_reviews.title: Slip joint pliers 16-inch
customer_reviews.text: I needed a large set of slip jaw pliers for plumbing work. I researched different brands and finally purchased this large set of Knipex brand and so glad I did. The tool is precision and extremely well made. The release button and lock keeps the jaws exactly where you set them. The tool is German made and very well built. I am now considering purchasing the smaller versions and replacing my Kliens and craftsman. Consider this a lifetime tool.
customer_reviews.author: captain moore

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality, precision pliers A+
customer_reviews.text: These are a well-designed, top quality tool. I watched the tradeshow demo's, and I was still 95% satisfied when holding them... -5% because the 10 inch pliers look to be just smaller than my old channel locks. + MICRO slide-groove adjustments, + working surfaces the jaws align well, and + textured dipped handles.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool has proven itself over and over. I use it for light construction. However, I have colleagues who use a 10-inch version every day in a laboratory environment and the tool outperforms other types of pliers. The cost of this tool is well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: I stopped a SNAP ON tool truck and he had both snap on brand and Knipex and recommend the Knipex
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I had never heard of this brand (Novice toolbox owner) but I do own several small Snap On tools and I needed a small open end to complete to box. I stopped a SNAP ON tool truck and he had both snap on brand and Knipex and recommend the Knipex, I would have bought but it was over $50, glad I waited saved me $$$ on Amazon. My son who is a Aircraft mechanic told me after the fact he owns many Knipex tools
customer_reviews.author: Tulie

customer_reviews.title: Jaws chipped after first use
customer_reviews.text: I wont deny these are great pliers. They have serious bite. However im kind of mad that the first time i used the tool somewhere along the way i chipped the jaw. Ive used tons of channel locks and never done that before.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Holds up very well in an industrial setting
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and holds up to abuse. I am an Imsustrial Maintenance Mechanic and need tools that can hold up. These pliers are fantastic. I’ve used them almost everyday for the last year and the jaws are still sharp and the grips are in great condition! I stopped using my 12” pipe wrench in favor of these! Just get it, you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Not for the daily user.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. But as a fitter who keeps his dogs handy; these are a pain when needing a size adjustment on the fly. The release button is accessible from 1 side only. I went back to my $10 U.S. made, Channel Locks!
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grip pliers
customer_reviews.text: These are like the alligator clamp pliers I used to own. Loved those and love these. These grip with very little effort from the person using them. Easy to adjust size to fit anything you need to tighten or loosen. Don't place jaws down into pants pocket as the jaws will cut through fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Joel C. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Best I've used
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I used these I could hardly believe how well they gripped compared to every other set I've used. If ordinary sets are pliers, these have the death grip of a pipe wrench in comparison. Small adjustment increments leave you with the perfect grip size and strong teeth with a great design really bite in well.
customer_reviews.author: Witt

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Quality, Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was a tiny bit reluctant to spend this much on a pair of pocket pliers, but very glad I did. Outstanding German quality. I carry them daily in my work pants and am surprised how much I use them. Tempted to toro my channel locks away to get the bigger ones!
customer_reviews.author: E. Shipman

customer_reviews.title: Multi-purpose and near razor sharp teeth
customer_reviews.text: I own these and the 10 inch cutters. As a automotive tech these things help me out way more then I expected them too. I've not had them long so time will tell, but the few days I've had them I've used them for just about anything I can, from crimping to removing rounded off bolts. Any tool that prevents me from having to walk back to my box is a great tool, any pliers/cutters etc I buy from this point on will be knipex as long as the price stays reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: German Channelocks
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the big deal is about this brand. Seems generally similar in use to Chanelocks. MSlightly harder to use as you have to push a button to slide one of the handles.
customer_reviews.author: McDouglas

customer_reviews.title: Quality, quality, Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great Plier...Being able to fine tune your adjustment, to the metal used to make this product has quality written all over it. I used the other box store pliers but this here is what I should have purchased from the get go. If I had gotten this from the beginning, I could have saved money.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie K

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Channel Locks with these and will never go back!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used other Knipex tools, and loved them. I’ve been using the semi needle tip players with strippers for some time now and my channel locks went missing so I bought these. First of all they open quite wide, second they lock into place once a size is selected, makes it easier when trying to tighten something with one hand while using the other to hold something. But the aggressiveness of the grab and the sturdiness of the rool is what truly sold me!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Just picking these up you can tell these are a well made, solid tool. Use channel locks almost on a daily basis and I am looking forward to using these. Not sure if Knipex was the brand at the time, but used to sell these in a hardward store 30 years ago. The standing on them when on a pipe (or their demonstration display) was impressive then and still is now.. Damn you Knipex, now I'm going to have to buy the 3 pack 7",10" & 12" Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: cruz

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Electrician here. After using channel lock brand for over 20 years, I decided to try these after hearing how a co-worker of mine loved them. Well, he was right. These are great. The button adjustment took only a few days of use to master and once you do it's not a problem. It won't slide out of place so if you're running 1" pipe it will stay in that position. The angles on the head really grips pipe and connectors very well. But what I like most is how thin they are. Makes a huge difference in getting in tighter spots. They are very strong and well made. I wish I bought these years ago. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Jaws not aligned. Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Craftsmanship is extremely disappointing. I had such high hopes after hearing rave reviews about all Knipex. As you can see in the photos the jaws are not aligned making these worthless. A slight movement would be acceptable but these jaws are off almost 50%.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pliers! These are some of the best imho
customer_reviews.text: First off i got recommend these pliers by my supervisor, after ordering them i wish i would have initially ordered the 3 pack. But they are awesome pliers that is for sure, I've only been able to use them for a handful of things but they bite down like no other pliers I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Audio_Freak

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for buy if for life tools.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried buying off brand tools that are similar but they just don't match the quality of Knipex. I buy these for stocking stuffers now because I know people won't spend this money for themselves but once they own a pair they use them all the time. This is a buy it for life tool right here.
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: 5inch, smaller than expected looks like a toy.
customer_reviews.text: 5 inch is a little smaller that I expected but it works great anyhow so I am glad I bought this one. Amazing how much higher quality these little toy pliers have over even the staple name brand locks, will never consider buying the blue ones again.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Knipex quality worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: These very small pliers are just right for those times I work on small parts because of the precise control they give and their slim profile. Excellent steel, jaw design and fit and finish of its parts. Although I like comfort grips on my tools, with this small pliers it would only get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Way better than traditional adjustable pliers
customer_reviews.text: These pliers are extremely high quality and do it all. Way better than traditional adjustable pliers. These bite on and do not let go. Metal is extremely high quality and even though these have been pretty abused since I've gotten them, the teeth are still perfect. I tore out a bathroom vanity, shower and tub fittings, using only these. Undoing fittings, taking out stripped screws (I was going to buy a pair of Vampliers but these appear to do the exact same thing), and grabbing onto pipes that you would usually have to use a big pipe wrench for.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Better than any adjustable wrench
customer_reviews.text: Really great tool! Typical KNIPEX quality, made in Germany. If you like to have the best, this is it. It is smaller than I expected though but seems capable of most tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Ari The Fonz

customer_reviews.title: Unreal grip
customer_reviews.text: Have three pairs of these - from the tiny 5" ones up to this beast. Never thought I'd use this big one. but did they paid for itself with one use. I only wish I could have afforded Knipex stuff when I was much younger. They would have saved a lot of cursing and scraped knuckles and bruises.
customer_reviews.author: RNeu2

customer_reviews.title: Great Product...
customer_reviews.text: I was always a fan of plain old Channel Lock brand from the beginning of my electrical career over 10 years ago until last year. A friend got me a set of these and I will carry nothing else. Quick adjustments, great grip, teeth don't wear quick, great quality. So great, that they were attempted to be stolen once and then successfully stolen haha. Buying a set here to replace my originals. I give these a 12 on a scale of 1-10!!
customer_reviews.author: JoshPow

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: These thing grip like crazy, and they seem hard enough to actually hold their edges. Just used these to pull all the caps on 4 u-joint bearings I was pressing out. This is usually a challenge since the caps are hard as well, but these things still gripped tight.
customer_reviews.author: NetMagi

customer_reviews.title: The Best. Period.
customer_reviews.text: My only regret is that I didn't pony up for the more comfortable grips, but design-wise; these are the best channel locks you'll ever own! So quick and easy to adjust to the exact size you need! They're light, loose and functional! I cannot recommend Knipex tools highly enough! German design wins again!
customer_reviews.author: The_Carr

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not as great as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Returned. These weren't the German 'quality' that I had expected. Maybe it was just this set of pliers but they had a 'gritty' feeling in the teeth and the slide wasn't smooth at all. Needed oiling I guess. For a 7.5" long pliers, these are on the small size.
customer_reviews.author: gamecock88

customer_reviews.title: Won’t Start Any Project Without ‘Em.
customer_reviews.text: Listen. Buy these. I don’t care what any anther reviewers say, because this is an AMAZING TOOL. I have done tasks with these that WILL NOT be done by any channelock pliers or any other brand tool. These grip onto anything. These will always be in my tool bag, and I won’t start any project without them at my side. These are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Quality and ease of use, well worth a little extra money
customer_reviews.text: Better than the rest and worth the slightly higher cost for a quality tool that should last my lifetime.....it has multiple areas that grip the part so well and the quick slide works just as it should. Would have liked to buy a Made in USA product but these Knipex Cobra Pliers are just plain better.
customer_reviews.author: lasignboy

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Pliers
customer_reviews.text: These pliers are perfectly capable of performing any task their size is suited for. The design of the jaws to always allow a parallel gripping surface is outstanding. My only wish would be for them to have been plated as many KNIPEX tools are.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Knipex pliers do not disappoint. Have used them at work several times (automotive field) and loved them so much I decided to buy this for myself. I currently own all of their cobra pliers and each one has its own thing its good at. The pliers are built extremely well and hold up to a lot of abuse! They’re pricey but extremely worth it compared to cheaper versions. The push button unlock is a wonderful part of these pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Knipex pliers do not disappoint. Have used them at work several times (automotive field) and loved them so much I decided to buy this for myself. I currently own all of their cobra pliers and each one has its own thing its good at. The pliers are built extremely well and hold up to a lot of abuse! They’re pricey but extremely worth it compared to cheaper versions. The push button unlock is a wonderful part of these pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: WHY DID I TAKE SO LONG TO BY THIS KIND OF QUALITY, YES DOUBLE THE PRICE OF OTHER BRANDS, BUT ARE YOU SMART ENOUGH TO REALLY ENJOY THIS NICE OF A TOOL, LET THE YOUNGSTERS BY THE OTHER BRANDS.
customer_reviews.author: THE MASTER

customer_reviews.title: Great design and a quality build.
customer_reviews.text: These tiny pliers are a wonder. They can firmly grip nuts up to inch and a quarter of pipe up to an inch. The compact size makes them very easy to carry in a pocket. They are similar in size to a mid sized pocket knife. The end closes precisely and the hard jaws gives great purchase even in iron or mild steel. It's a quality tool that should last.
customer_reviews.author: Mash5boom

customer_reviews.title: This was my first Knippex purchase after being disappointed with some of the newer USA made tools I ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Knippex purchase after being disappointed with some of the newer USA made tools I have. I have been using these every day in a shop for a few months and the teeth on the jaws are still as they were new. Im impressed with the steel this are made of. And as for the function of these pliers I really like them. They are quick and easy to adjust, work very well for many different applications, and for being smaller sized pliers they can clamp fairly large objects. Overall am happy with them and plan to buy more from Knippex.
customer_reviews.author: Bh

customer_reviews.title: slip joint pliers
customer_reviews.text: After using a a name brand version for almost 50 years I am switching allegiance. These have almost infinite adjustments. The grip is amazing. The jaws have a interesting offset which makes grabbing odd shapes very easy. Highly recommend these pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Delayne W.

customer_reviews.title: Not much to type on this one. Its just great
customer_reviews.text: I mean it's my edc pocket carry it grips, the teeth haven't rounded over and its amazing in ergonomics and leverage. Its more capable than it looks. Not much else to say. Normally i type alot more but im happy with this it opens up to 2" if u squeeze the object in there which for ed objects thats more than enough
customer_reviews.author: 🖕🏽

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: Best pair Of channel locks I’ve owned. Love the narrow handles and the jaws grip well. Once you set the size they don’t fall out. Nothing is more annoying than being at work in a tight space trying to use channel locks 1 handed when they open up and fall out of adjustment. Initially was annoyed that the lock was stiff and wouldn’t fall into place all the time. Once they were broke in they started working better. Still happens but not as often. Best pair of channies I’ve ever used as an electrician.
customer_reviews.author: caleb

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know any better pliers!
customer_reviews.text: Love these pliers. Use them every day in my electrical work; they reach and grip where no other pair of pliers would work. Curious note, I have a pair of Craftsman pliers that are identical. Also, they have worked so well for me, I went and bought the whole set! Excellent tools.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Ahlgren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, Knipex tools are in a league of their own in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of vice grips/pliers I’ve ever owned. Yes their a bit expensive but they are so worth it! The teeth are extremely well machined and hardened. When I think of quality this company Knipex comes to my mind! Also own a pair of their end cutters which are built just as well and a excellent tool to have. These are something I could see myself passing down to my kids one day when I have a family of my own. Highly recommend not just these but Knipex tools in general. Yes their a little pricey but worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Antonietti

customer_reviews.title: Small but incredibly useful and versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I work as a first responder so I needed something to compliment the Leatherman surge that I carry on my belt. The Knipex brand is one of the few that I recommend and the size is beyond incredible. The amount of tasks and versatility these small pliers gives you is truly amazing. I was skeptical given the size but after purchasing them, I now own 4 or 5 pair and won’t carry anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Superior
customer_reviews.text: Total amateur here, but even I can tell these are superior quality. Quick note: the Cobras you can adjust with one hand - big advantage in tight spaces..
customer_reviews.author: Loch

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING BUY!!! THESE THINGS ARE PERFECT IN EVERY WAY!!!
customer_reviews.text: As an oilfield electrician I use these things A LOT!!! Breaking unions, putting on cord grips, twisting in nipples...they have a grip better than ANY others I have used! I have 2 pairs of the 12 inch, and I also have 2 pairs of the 12 inch smooth jaw knipex as well! Nothing but great things to say about them!
customer_reviews.author: its me

product_meta.title: KNIPEX Tools 87 01 250 10-Inch Cobra Pliers
product_meta.description:
Size:10-InchNo more time-consuming test-adjusting of the correct opening size. Just position the upper jaw to the workpiece, push button and move close the lower jaw, ingeniously simple. 30% more capacity than a conventional pipe wrench. Self-locking on pipes and nuts due to teeth set against the rotation - no slipping on the workpiece. Pinch guard prevents fingers from being pinched. Adjustment at the touch of a button. Has 25 adjustment positions to adjust to hex nuts up to 1 13/16" and round pipe up to 2".

AMAZON.COM


Self locking on pipes and nuts (view larger).No more time-consuming test-adjusting to achieve the correct size. With the Knipex Cobra water pump pliers, you can simply position the upper jaw to the workpiece, push the button, and close the lower jaw. And you'll also be able to say goodbye to blood blisters you get with other gripping pliers. With safety its first priority, Knipex has designed a built-in pinch guard that prevents blood blisters on your hand.

The unique self-locking adjustment and induction hardened gripping teeth means that once it's set, it stays. There's no slipping and no need to waste strength squeezing the pliers — ensuring operator safety and more efficient work. Cobra's unique jaw configuration can grip any shape object — flat, round, hex, or square. It also eliminates nut burring to avoid stripping pipes, nuts, or bolts. Additionally, the Cobra's newly redesigned adjustment provides 30 percent more gripping capacity than previous models.

A simple push of the patented push button adjustment maintains jaw size setting and gives you the correct size opening every time. Just position the upper jaw to the workpiece, push the button, adjust the opening, and close the lower jaw. And it's easily done with just one hand for trouble-free operation in confined spaces. 

Cobra water pump pliers are constructed from chrome vanadium electric steel, an innovative high alloy, oil tempered steel that ensures longevity. And their thin head design helps you get into spaces other pliers can't, so there's no need to change tools when working in tight confines. 

Patented push button system (view larger).QUALITY IN EVERY DETAIL
Sometimes we give our pliers a really hard time. We try to destroy them to find out what makes them good and long-lasting. Because we don't want to leave anything to chance, we take a long, careful look. 

The steel Knipex uses is precisely hardened with a maximum of 0.8 percent carbon and defined parts of chromium and vanadium, guaranteeing optimum cutting performance and service life — even though it requires special production and costs a bit more. But our high product demands require this.

The rivet of our high-leverage diagonal cutter also has to stand up to a lot of stress. That's why we literally give it backup: we forge it straight onto the pliers. This means extra effort as we have to precision mill the rivet to a few hundredth millimeters. But satisfied users are worth this effort.

Knipex also looks closely at the small details. The angles, the sharpness, the hardness, the toughness of the cutting edges. The precision and smooth movement of the joint. The handle design and the finish. We keep reviewing these subjects, we research, we test, and we improve our pliers.

ABOUT KNIPEX
Headquartered in Wuppertal, Germany, Knipex is an independently-owned family enterprise steeped in tradition and specializing in the manufacturing of high-quality pliers. It all started back in 1882 when C. Gustav Putsch set up his own forge shop in Cronenberg (now a suburb of Wuppertal), and the company is now run by a fourth generation of that family. The world's leading brand in pliers today, Knipex is focused on the performance, service life, and ergonomics of its tools in order to meet the high expectations of professional users.

87 01 250 COBRA PLIERS, 10-INCH
AT A GLANCE
 * Adjustment at the touch of a button directly on the workpiece
 * Fast, firm adjustment directly on the workpiece
 * Self-locking on pipes and nuts: no slipping on the workpiece and low hand force required
 * Gripping surfaces with special hardened teeth
 * Pinch guard prevents operators' fingers from being pinched
 * Chrome vanadium heavy-duty steel, forged and oil-hardened


See larger image.
SPECIFICATIONS
 * Jaw capacity: Up to 2-inch for round and 1-13/16-inch for hex
 * Adjustment positions: 25
 * Length: 10 inches
 * Weight: 11.1 ounces
 * Handles: Plastic coating



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
With these Knipex 8701250 10-Inch Cobra Pliers, fast adjustment directly on the work piece eliminates time-consuming test adjusting of the correct opening size. Just position the upper jaw to the work piece, push button on pliers and move close the lower jaw. Once adjusted the pliers self-lock on pipes and nuts with no slipping. Optimized shape jaw will grip round, square and hex shaped material. The box joint design provides high stability because of the double guide.

See more

Comfortable In Use And Quality Assured Design
Fit To Match The Needs In The Shop, At Home Or In The Service Field
Each Tool Is Proven And Tested For Durability And Function In Real World Use And Conditions
